revised_title: A Description of a Unique Monstrous Calf
tldr: A butcher in Lymington, Hampshire, killed a cow to fatten it and found a monstrous calf in its womb. The calf had hair, no joints in its hind legs, and a triple tongue. It also rode on a large stone, which weighed twenty pounds and a half, and had a sternum made of stone. The story was communicated to the Royal Society by Robert Boyle.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Animal Anatomy
